qas.question: What year did HNIC begin being broadcasted on CBC?
What did CBC air during the NHL lockout?
What did CBC call it's movie showings during the NHL Lockout?
On what nights does CBC generally reserve broadcasting for hockey?
what popular show has aired on the CBC since its inception in 1952?
The NHL refused the CBC access to hockey games during which season?
The CBC lost sponsorship when they refused to air what games?

plausible_answers.text: Toronto Raptors basketball, Toronto FC Soccer,

qas.question: When movie Night in Canada was not successful, what other sports team rights did the CBC acquire?

context: One of the most popular shows on CBC Television is the weekly <a3_0>Saturday<a3_0/> night broadcast of NHL hockey games, <b4_0>Hockey Night in Canada<b4_0/>. It has been televised by the network since <a0_0>1952<a0_0/>. During the NHL lockout and subsequent cancellation of the <b5_0>2004-2005<b5_0/> hockey season, CBC instead aired <a1_0>various recent and classic movies<a1_0/>, branded as <a2_0>Movie Night in Canada<a2_0/>, on Saturday nights. Many cultural groups criticized this and suggested the CBC air games from <b6_0>minor hockey leagues<b6_0/>; the CBC responded that most such broadcast rights were already held by other groups, but it did base each Movie Night broadcast from a different Canadian hockey venue. Other than hockey, CBC Sports properties include <b7_0>Toronto Raptors basketball, Toronto FC Soccer,<b7_0/> and various other amateur and professional events.
